excerpt: The coastal resort of Playa del Inglés is a main nightlife hub, packed with British pubs and LGBTQ dance clubs. The beach draws summer crowds for sunbathing and water sports, while camel rides are available at the towering Dunes of Maspalomas in the El Oasis nature area. Local craft shops and boutiques are scattered amid chain stores, and dining options range from classic Canarian cuisine to burgers and kebabs.
detail_description: Playa del Inglés is a vibrant coastal resort known for its bustling nightlife scene, featuring British pubs and LGBTQ dance clubs. The beach attracts sunbathers and water sports enthusiasts, while the nearby Dunes of Maspalomas offer camel rides in the El Oasis nature area. Visitors can explore local craft shops and boutiques alongside chain stores, and enjoy a diverse dining scene ranging from traditional Canarian cuisine to casual options like burgers and kebabs.
name: Playa del Inglés
address: 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Maspalomas is a resort town in the south of Gran Canaria, in Spain’s Canary Islands. It’s known for its vast expanse of coastal dunes. These encompass the Maspalomas Dunes nature reserve. It contains several ecosystems, including the La Charca Lagoon, palm groves and the dunes, rich in birdlife like plovers, snipes and herons. The tall, slender Maspalomas Lighthouse has been operating since the late 19th century.
detail_description: Maspalomas, a resort town in the southern part of Gran Canaria, Spain's Canary Islands, is renowned for its expansive coastal dunes within the Maspalomas Dunes nature reserve. This area boasts diverse ecosystems including La Charca Lagoon, palm groves, and bird-rich dunes. The iconic Maspalomas Lighthouse has been guiding ships since the late 19th century.
name: Maspalomas
address: 35100, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Watery fun for families with a multitude of slides, a kids' area & dining options.
detail_description: Aqualand Maspalomas is a top destination for families seeking aquatic fun in Maspalomas. The park offers an exciting variety of water slides and attractions suitable for all ages, ensuring a day filled with laughter and adventure. From adrenaline-pumping slides to more relaxed pools, there's something for everyone. Children can splash around in the dedicated kids' area while adults soak up the Canarian sunshine or join in on the excitement.
name: Aqualand Maspalomas
address: Carr. Palmitos Park, Km 3, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Known for its rustic beauty, this wide sand beach is next to an extensive dune network.
detail_description: Playa de Maspalomas is a stunning beach located in the Canary Islands, known for its picturesque sand dunes and expansive golden shore. Stretching over 3km, it is the second longest beach on the island, offering plenty of space for sunbathing and leisurely walks through the dunes. The area features lifeguard towers and snack bars, ensuring a safe and enjoyable experience for visitors.
name: Playa de Maspalomas
address: Spain

excerpt: Landmark 1890s lighthouse, a popular place to watch the sunset, with a beach, shops & bars nearby.
detail_description: Faro de Maspalomas is a historic lighthouse built in the 1890s, located at one end of Maspalomas beach near the iconic Maspalomas Dunes. It's a popular spot for watching breathtaking sunsets and enjoying the pleasant temperatures of Gran Canaria, which range from around 23C in winter to 30C in summer.
name: Faro de Maspalomas
address: Pl. del Faro, 15, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Dune-fringed 18-hole golf course on 988-acres with practice areas, a restaurant & pro shop.
detail_description: Maspalomas Golf is a renowned 18-hole course nestled in a 988-acre area, featuring practice areas, a restaurant, and a pro shop. Situated near other notable golf courses like Real Club de Golf de Las Palmas and Meloneras Golf by Lopesan, Maspalomas Golf offers stunning views of the sea and Gran Canaria's high peaks.
name: Maspalomas Golf
address: Av. Touroperador Neckermann, s/n, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Stylish resort Meloneras is known for its working 1890s lighthouse, the Faro de Maspalomas, a popular spot for sunset viewing and starting point for headland walks. Nearby are perfume, jewelry, and clothing stores, plus the Moonlight Cinema for outdoor film screenings. Lively beach bars and grill restaurants line the Paseo de las Meloneras waterfront. Sailing excursions depart from Puerto Deportivo.
detail_description: Meloneras is a stylish resort known for its iconic 1890s lighthouse, the Faro de Maspalomas, which offers stunning sunset views and serves as the starting point for scenic headland walks. The area boasts an array of attractions including perfume, jewelry, and clothing stores, as well as the Moonlight Cinema for outdoor film screenings. Along the Paseo de las Meloneras waterfront, visitors can enjoy lively beach bars and grill restaurants.
name: Meloneras
address: Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Popular attraction offering 30-minute camel rides for adults & kids through scenic sand dunes.
detail_description: Embark on an extraordinary adventure with a Camel Safari in Maspalomas, Gran Canaria. This popular attraction offers 30-minute camel rides for both adults and kids, allowing you to traverse the scenic sand dunes in a unique and memorable way. After your camel safari, you can partake in other captivating activities such as sandboarding or simply bask in the serene ambiance of the surroundings.
name: Camel safari
address: C. Oceanía, 35100 Gran Canaria, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Known for its multiple bars & restaurants, this open-air mall also hosts varied retailers.
detail_description: The Kasbah Shopping Center is a vibrant open-air mall in Gran Canaria, known for its diverse range of retailers, bars, and restaurants. It's a popular tourist destination with options like the Pacha Gran Canaria nightclub nearby. The area also offers lively party destinations such as Plaza and Yumbo shopping center. While some parts have seen decline, there are plans for redevelopment. Visitors can enjoy great outlets, dining options, and live music in the evenings.
name: Kasbah Shopping Center
address: Av. Arquitecto Manuel de la Peña Suarez, 7, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Current movies are screened at this unique outdoor cinema offering comfy couches & cocktails.
detail_description: Experience the magic of outdoor cinema at Moonlight Cinema, Europe's only permanent open-air movie theater located on the top floor of a main shopping mall in Maspalomas. Relax on luxurious sofas with blankets and enjoy your favorite films under the stars. Indulge in stone-baked pizza, popcorn, and nachos while sipping cocktails or wine ordered from the comfort of your seat.
name: Moonlight Cinema
address: C.C. Boulevard Oasis, Av. Cristóbal Colón, s/n, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: San Agustín is a sleepy beach district on a sheltered bay popular for diving and snorkeling. The Paseo Costa Canaria promenade stretches all the way to the Playa del Inglés. Restaurants with terraces overlooking the Atlantic serve shellfish, while marketlike food stalls are dotted around mainstream shopping centers. Local nightlife mixes casual beach bars with stylish discos and hotel cocktail lounges.
detail_description: San Agustín is a tranquil beach district nestled in a sheltered bay, renowned for its excellent diving and snorkeling opportunities. The Paseo Costa Canaria promenade offers a scenic stroll all the way to Playa del Inglés, with numerous restaurants boasting terraces overlooking the Atlantic and serving delectable shellfish dishes. This area is perfect for those seeking relaxation away from the hustle and bustle of city life, offering serene beaches and stunning views where mountains meet the ocean.
name: San Agustín
address: 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Holiday World is a vibrant amusement park featuring a prominent Ferris Wheel and an array of thrilling rides and attractions, including a bowling alley. Visitors can delight in the mesmerizing laser show while enjoying the park's unique no entrance fee policy, opting instead for rechargeable cards and points to access its offerings.
name: Holiday World
address: Sonnenland, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Seaside shoppping center featuring a variety of stores & restaurants, plus landscaped green spaces.
detail_description: Boulevard El Faro is a charming seaside shopping center with a variety of stores and restaurants, as well as landscaped green spaces. The area near the lighthouse boasts outdoor cafes and upscale restaurants, offering a higher price range but an elevated presentation and atmosphere. Additionally, the Boulevard El Faro shopping arcade features premium brand names and well-stocked stores. This leafy shopping mall also offers decent dining options, including El Caldero for quality Valencian food.
name: Boulevard El Faro
address: C. Mar Mediterráneo, 35100 Meloneras, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Yumbo Centre is a popular spot for the gay community in Gran Canaria, particularly in Playa del Ingles. By day, it's a shopping center, but at night it transforms into a vibrant hub of nightlife with various LGBT-friendly bars and clubs. The area caters to different interests such as bears, leather, mature men, drag shows, and more. It's also known for hosting specialist discos and drag performances.
name: Yumbo Centre
address: Av. Estados Unidos, 54, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: San Fernando Parish Church, located in Maspalomas, is a significant historical landmark with simple yet striking architecture. The church hosts beautiful Spanish services and offers Mass at midday. It also features a Christmas market and free skating rink for kids during the holiday season. Additionally, the church grounds include a manicured park and kids playground, making it an ideal spot for family activities.
name: Parroquia de San Fernando
address: Calle, Av. de Tejeda, nº 7, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Arid coastal nature reserve spanning 998-acres with desert-like sand dunes.
detail_description: Dunas de Maspalomas is a 998-acre arid coastal nature reserve featuring desert-like sand dunes. Classified as a Protected Natural Site in 1944, these golden sand mountains extend for almost six kilometers and can reach heights of almost 25 meters. Despite being a popular location, the area offers incredible scenery and tranquility. It's recommended to visit at sunrise for a quieter and peaceful experience due to its popularity among tourists.
name: Dunas de Maspalomas
address: 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: La Charca is a serene pond nestled within the Maspalomas Nature Reserve, bordered by the sea and sand dunes. It's a haven for various bird species, making it a paradise for bird watchers. The lagoon is teeming with fish, and during migration seasons, it serves as a resting place for birds traveling between Europe and Africa.
name: La Charca
address: 35100, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Bahia Feliz stands out as a tranquil escape from the lively resorts found elsewhere along the southern coast of Gran Canaria. This narrow seaside resort offers a variety of accommodations, including bungalows, apartments, and hotels surrounded by ample outdoor areas. While it may not boast the expansive beaches of neighboring Puerto Rico and Maspalomas/Playa del Ingles, Bahia Feliz features a lengthy coastal promenade and secluded small beaches dotted along its shoreline.
name: Bahia Feliz
address: 35100, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: La Charca de Maspalomas is a tranquil lagoon nestled in the vibrant surroundings of Maspalomas. It serves as a haven for various bird species, making it a paradise for birdwatchers. Adjacent to the unearthly Maspalomas dunes and the flourishing nature reserve, this spot offers stunning views and diverse wildlife.
name: La Charca de Maspalomas
address: Av. del Oasis, 22, 35100 San Bartolomé de Tirajana, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Bustling beach area popular with tourists for its numerous hotels, eateries & shopping options.
detail_description: English Beach, located on Gran Canaria's southernmost tip, is a bustling area popular with tourists due to its numerous hotels, eateries, and shopping options. The beach features a sprawling strip of biscuit-colored sand that stretches for nearly three kilometers and is adorned with unique rolling dunes. Visitors can enjoy a mix of big-name chain restaurants and independent beach bars along the shoreline. Lined with hotels and shops, this certified tourist haven attracts families and nature enthusiasts from around the world.
name: English beach
address: Spain

excerpt: Wide sandy beach features calm waters & a lively promenade with bars, restaurants & nearby lodging.
detail_description: Playa de las Burras is a wide sandy beach known for its calm waters and lively promenade. The area offers various bars, restaurants, and nearby lodging options. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll along the beachfront or take a refreshing dip in the sea. The beach is situated near San Agustin beach, separated by a picturesque rocky headland.
name: Playa de las Burras
address: Spain

excerpt: Lush botanical garden featuring local & exotic plant species, plus birds, insects & butterflies.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Maspalomas, Parque Botánico is a verdant oasis that showcases an impressive collection of over 500 plant species. This botanical garden beautifully blends local flora from the Canary Islands with exotic varieties, thanks to its unique microclimate. Visitors can wander through lush pathways while enjoying the sights and sounds of vibrant birds and fluttering butterflies. Although it’s a smaller park, it offers a peaceful retreat for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle.
name: Parque Botánico de Maspalomas
address: Av. Touroperador Neckermann, 2, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Shopping Center Gran Chaparral is a popular open-air destination, especially among Dutch tourists. It features British pubs and is known for being a great place to watch football while enjoying the sunny weather with a cold beer. Visitors can find affordable options at Kim's bar and enjoy good food as well as holiday gifts. The center offers various dining options, including the Britannia restaurant, which serves fresh food and reasonably priced drinks.
name: Shopping Center Gran Chaparral
address: Av. de Gran Canaria, 30, 35100 San Bartolomé de Tirajana, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Exploring the Maspalomas Dunes is an adventure that combines natural beauty with a unique experience. Located at the western end, near Avenida Tirajana and the Charco de Maspalomas lagoon, this area features lush bushes and palm trees. A stroll from Dunas Mirador in Playa del Ingles leads you to these stunning dunes, where you might even encounter some nudists enjoying the sun. For those looking for a memorable outing, consider booking a dromedary ride through the dunes.
name: Maspalomas Dunes dromedary
address: C. Oceanía, 13, 35100 San Bartolomé de Tirajana, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: The restaurant Ovo is located in the exclusive Hotel Lopesan Villa del Conde, and it offers a phenomenal market cuisine that combines the best products of the islands with the amazing Canarian recipes. The food was excellent in every respect, and we would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great meal.
name: Ovo | Lopesan Villa del Conde
address: C. Mar Mediterráneo, 7, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Mountainous subtropical landscape with walking paths, dolphin shows & orchid & butterfly houses.
detail_description: Palmitos Park is a must-visit attraction on Gran Canaria, offering a diverse range of experiences for the whole family. The park is divided into five areas: Birds, The Garden, Aquarium, Reptiles, and Mammals. Visitors can explore the Cage of Lories to see colorful birds from around the world and the House of Butterflies, which boasts being the largest in Europe.
name: Palmitos Park
address: Barranco de los Palmitos, s/n, 35109 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

excerpt: Picturesque wide sand beach connected to a promenade with snorkeling & scuba diving.
detail_description: The Playa de San Agustín beach is a great place to enjoy the sun and sand with plenty of activities nearby, such as snorkeling and diving. It is usually less crowded than similar beaches on the island and is perfect for a relaxing afternoon or evening.
name: Playa de San Agustín
address: Spain

excerpt: Tranquil sandy strip with sun loungers, popular for its warm water & backed by hotels & restaurants.
detail_description: Playa de Meloneras is a tranquil and family-friendly beach located in Gran Canaria's southwestern corner, near Maspalomas' sand dunes. This 500-meter stretch of soft golden sands offers plenty of space for visitors to relax and enjoy the warm, calm waters. Following a recent makeover, the area now features luxurious hotels, high-end designer shops, and a variety of seafront restaurants.
name: Playa de Meloneras
address: 35100, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Parque Tony Gallardo is a small botanical garden in Maspalomas, Gran Canaria. It's open from 10:00 to 14:00, Tuesday to Saturday and offers free entry. The park features a variety of native plants and trees, as well as bird species, insects, frogs, and Canaria lizards. Visitors can enjoy the peaceful surroundings and learn about the different species through informative boards scattered around the garden. The park is wheelchair accessible and provides clean restroom facilities.
name: Parque Tony Gallardo
address: Av. Touroperador Tui, 20, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Playa Nudista Montaña Arena is a secluded and unspoiled beach on the southwestern coast of Gran Canaria. It's a favorite among local nudists and offers a tranquil escape from the more touristy beaches in the area. Accessible via a 15-minute walk along a coastal dirt path, this hidden gem has no facilities nearby, so visitors are advised to pack lightly and bring their own food and drinks.
name: Playa Nudista Montaña Arena
address: 35106 Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: Finca Canarias Aloe Vera Fataga is a must-visit during the Typical Villages Tour in Gran Canaria. This full-day excursion offers a comprehensive exploration of the island's beautiful towns, valleys, and its spectacular center. Visitors get to delve into the history, customs, and local life while also having the opportunity to visit an aloe vera plantation. The farm provides an engaging tour that is both entertaining and informative, offering insights into the production process of Aloe Vera products.
name: Finca Canarias Aloe Vera Fataga
address: Carretera, GC-60, km 36, 5, 35108 Fataga, Las Palmas, Spain

name: Cristóbal Colón
address: 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain

detail_description: The boat tour agency Dolphins Multiacuatic Gran Canaria offers an incredible experience, providing the opportunity to see two different pods of dolphins and flying fish. The helpful staff are available to assist those who may not be comfortable at sea. The package includes a complimentary beverage and onboard restroom facilities, although it is advisable to use the facilities before departure. With a 96% chance of spotting dolphins, this excursion comes highly recommended for everyone.
name: Dolphins Multiacuatic Gran Canaria
address: C. Puerto Base, 35130 Puerto Rico, Las Palmas, Spain

name: Galeria ARTE
address: comercial San Agustin, C. las Dalias, 12, local 339 Centro, 35100 Maspalomas, Las Palmas, Spain
